```{r set up}
library(tidyverse)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  fig.width = 6,
  fig.asp = .6,
  out.width = "90%"
)
```


```{r}
weather_df = 
  rnoaa::meteo_pull_monitors(
    c("USW00094728", "USW00022534", "USS0023B17S"),
    var = c("PRCP", "TMIN", "TMAX"), 
    date_min = "2021-01-01",
    date_max = "2022-12-31") |>
  mutate(
    name = recode(
      id, 
      USW00094728 = "CentralPark_NY", 
      USW00022534 = "Molokai_HI",
      USS0023B17S = "Waterhole_WA"),
    tmin = tmin / 10,
    tmax = tmax / 10) |>
  select(name, id, everything())
```


```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x=tmin, y=tmax, color=name)) +
  geom_point(alpha=0.5) +
  labs(
    x= "Min daily temp (degrees C)",
    y="max daily temp",
    color = "location",
    title = "Temperature plot",
    caption = "Max vs. min daily temp in three locations; data from rnoaa"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(-15, 0, 15),
    labels = c("-15 C", "0", "15")
  )+
  scale_y_continuous(
    position = "right",
    limits = c(20, 30)
    ##trans = "sqrt"
  )
 
##labs helps you change labels for axes, color key, title, caption, etc.
##scale_x_continuous helps you adjust scale of plot
## you can do a log transformation or square root transformation of the scale using "trans"
 
 ## you can add limits to the y or x scale with "limits"
```
